intro: Antirrhinum lanigerum, commonly known as the woolly snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Antirrhinum lanigerum is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its adaptability to various garden conditions.
